course = df.loc[:, ['level','num_subscribers']]
course['count'] = course.groupby('level')['num_subscribers'].transform('sum')
course = course.sort_values('count', ascending=False)
course.drop('num_subscribers', axis=1, inplace=True)
course = course.drop_duplicates().reset_index(drop=True)
course = course.head()

source.487b03d0:
ucourses = df.loc[:, ['year','num_subscribers']]
ucourses['count'] = ucourses.groupby('year')['num_subscribers'].transform('sum')
#course = course.sort_values('count', ascending=True)
ucourses.drop('num_subscribers', axis=1, inplace=True)
ucourses = ucourses.drop_duplicates().reset_index(drop=True)
ucourses.sort_values('year', inplace=True)
ucourses
ucourses['Subscribercount'] = ucourses['count'].cumsum()
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
import plotly.graph_objects as go

fig = make_subplots(
    rows=1, 
    cols=1,
    subplot_titles=("Time series plot of number of subscribers",
                    ))

fig.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=ucourses['year'],
    y=ucourses['Subscribercount'],
    name="All",
    mode='lines'),
    row=1, col=1)
fig.show()
source.21a89fdb:
course = df.loc[:, ['year','month','subject','num_subscribers']]
course['count'] = course.groupby(['year','month','subject'])['num_subscribers'].transform('sum')
#course = course.sort_values('count', ascending=True)
#course.drop('num_subscribers', axis=1, inplace=True)
course = course.drop_duplicates().reset_index(drop=True)
course.sort_values(['year','month'], inplace=True)

course2011=course.loc[course.year==2011]
course2012=course.loc[course.year==2012]
course2012Music=course2012.loc[course.subject=='Musical Instruments']
course2012Web=course2012.loc[course.subject=='Web Development']
course2012Design=course2012.loc[course.subject=='Graphic Design']
course2012Fin=course2012.loc[course.subject=='Business Finance']

course2013Web=course2013.loc[course.subject=='Web Development']

source.3227e7fd:
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
import plotly.graph_objects as go

fig1 = make_subplots(
    rows=1, 
    cols=1,
    subplot_titles=("Month Wise for the year 2012",))


fig1.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2012Music['month'], 
    y=course2012Music['num_subscribers'], 
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Music",
    line=dict(color="#74597D", dash="longdashdot"),
),
    row=1, col=1)
fig1.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2012Web['month'], 
    y=course2012Web['num_subscribers'] , 
    
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Web",
    line=dict(color="#C85A17", dash="dash")
),
    row=1, col=1)
fig1.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2012Design['month'], 
    y=course2012Design['num_subscribers'], 
    
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Design",
  
    line=dict(color="#1884C7", dash="dashdot")
),
    row=1, col=1)

fig1.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2012Fin['month'], 
    y=course2012Fin['num_subscribers'], 
    
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Finance",
  
    line=dict(color="#617C58", dash="dashdot")
),
    row=1, col=1)

fig1.update_layout(width=700, height=600)
fig1.show()

fig2 = make_subplots(
    rows=1, 
    cols=1,
    subplot_titles=("Month Wise for the year 2013",))
fig2.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2013Music['month'], 
    y=course2013Music['num_subscribers'], 
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Music",
    line=dict(color="#74597D", dash="longdashdot"),
),
    row=1, col=1)
fig2.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2013Web['month'], 
    y=course2013Web['num_subscribers'] , 
    
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Web",
    line=dict(color="#C85A17", dash="dash")
),
    row=1, col=1)
fig2.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2013Design['month'], 
    y=course2013Design['num_subscribers'], 
    
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Design",
  
    line=dict(color="#1884C7", dash="dashdot")
),
    row=1, col=1)
fig2.append_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=course2013Fin['month'], 
    y=course2013Fin['num_subscribers'], 
    
    mode="lines+markers",
    name="Finance",
  
    line=dict(color="#617C58", dash="dashdot")
),
    row=1, col=1)
fig2.update_layout(width=700, height=600)
fig2.show()

fig.update_traces(rotation=90, pull=0.05, textinfo="percent+label")

source.c21bf3cb: Price does not depend on the duration of subject. Price depends on content or the professor who is teaching this subject
source.ff22acb3: There are outliers in review but data set we cannot get information whether the reviews are good or bad hence require additional information.
source.b4971b14: #### Whether number of subscriber depends on number of lecture
source.e93c99db: There is positive trend in no of subscriber
source.5766c420: Content duration does not have much effect on Subscriber
source.3b017ffe: Highest subscriber are when the price is low. Only one record has highest subscriber when price is zero.
source.32664e5e: number of lecture does not have much impact on number of subscriber
source.838b9ac6: in price there is no outlier
source.bb8e9246: #### Whether number of subscriber depends on price
source.599122e1: There are outliers in num_lecture whether it is a genuine data or anamoly we need to analyze
source.7b0d1c75: number of reviews does not have impact on number of subscribers. We have only number of review hence we don't have much information review whether review is good or bad we cannot comment whether review is associated with number of subscriber
source.b6dc0de8: From box plot we can analyze that very few have content duration greater than 50
source.f786b795: From six years(2012,2013,2014,2015,2016,2017) it is being observed that there is high demand in web development course in the months between January to June. Initially Music course had high subscribers which gradually reduced by 2017.
source.1f90fc7f: Paid courses of webdevelopment has more subscribers than unpaid. Hence Udemy should publish their paid web development course in between January to June to get maximum subscribers,
source.8b850942: 67.9% of subscriber opt for web development hence majority of subscriber opt for web development course.
source.753cd064: ** Udemy is an American online learning platform aimed at professional adults and students. Udemy dataset for the year 2011-2017 helps to analyze & visualize which course is highly viewed or purchased,which courses udemy should focus on,when udemy should publish their new courses.**
source.9ae96408: #### Whether no of subscriber depends on reviews?
source.88e4985d: #### Whether no of subscriber depends on Price?
source.488526c2: #### Whether  number of subscriber  depends on content duration
source.659b9e97: there is one outlier which is above 250000 which may be because of free of cost or may be due good review or may be any anamolies.Lets invetsigate further whether it is a genuine data or a anamoly
source.78da262e:
Majority of udemy subscribers are paid subsribers. The courses play major role than whether it is paid or not.


Note:-For the year 2017 we have data till July month.
source.f1de0af6: According to the graph we can state there is a increase in subscriber. Majority subcribers are there when price is 0.
